bibl.author: Bethuel Smith
bibl.title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 22 October 1864
bibl.orgName: Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: Added encoding for annotations made by John from UVA.

body.p: I arrived home the 18 I had to stop over my on account of Sheridan fighting in the valley mother told me that you wanted me to stop & see you when I come home but it is to late now & I did not hear of it in time there is considerable excitement here about the election.

my health is not verry good at present I have got diarrhea some I think that it is on account of the change
of climate & of food that makes me so although I feel verry well

postscript.p:
Address
Bethuel Smith.
Glens Falls.
Warren. C.O.
N.Y.
